title: June, 2024
content: One paper about large-scale graph data mining is accepted by 50th International Conference on Very Large Databases (VLDB 2024)

title: June, 2024
content: One paper about fairness-aware urban sensing is accepted by The 21st IEEE International Conference on Mobile Ad-Hoc and Smart Systems (IEEE MASS 2024)

title: June, 2024
content: Check recent FSU news about our sustainability project. https://news.fsu.edu/news/science-technology/2024/05/30/aspire-fsu-faculty-members-lead-work-to-craft-sustainable-solutions-for-a-resilient-future/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=the_big_story_june_3_2024&utm_term=2024-06-03

title: June, 2024
content: Invited to serve on an NSF Panel.

title: May, 2024
content: Invited to serve on a DOE Panel.

title: May, 2024
content: Invited to serve on an NSF Panel.

title: May, 2024
content: One paper about Behavior-Aware Coordinates Mining is accepted by IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE). Excellent work.

title: May, 2024
content: Two papers are accepted by ACM KDD. One is about Mobility Data Privacy Risk and another is about Link Prediction in Billion-Scale Commercial Heterogeneous Graphs. Excellent work.

title: April, 2024
content: Congratulations to my PhD student Tonmoy for successfully passing his Prospectus Defense and also winning the Outstanding TA Award! Excellent research and teaching achievements!

title: April, 2024
content: I gave a guest lecture in FAMU-FSU College of Engineering. Thank Dr. Guo for the invitation!

title: April, 2024
content: Our $2.26M project in collaboration with Rutgers and UCLA was funded by NSF (my role: FSU PI). Many thanks to the NSF and our fabulous team!

title: April, 2024
content: Our paper about community map generation was accepted to ACM IMWUT/UbiComp. Excellent work. One of my favorite papers. Many Thanks to Zhiqing!

title: April, 2024
content: Congratulations to my graduate student David for successfully defending his thesis. Excellent work on vehicle dispatching and redeployment for Emergency Medical Services with Reinforcement Learning.

title: April, 2024
content: My undergraduate student Judah presents our EV project at the FSU Undergraduate Research Symposium. Excellent work.

title: March, 2024
content: I attended the NSF Aspiring CPS PIs' Workshop and PI meeting. Thank NSF for providing this great opportunity. Wonderful experience.

title: Feb, 2024
content: I attended the NSF S&CC PI meeting. Thank NSF for providing this great opportunity. Wonderful experience.

title: January, 2024
content: Our paper finally got accepted by Nature Cities after a very long journey. This is the major project I did at MIT. This is also my first paper to be published in a Nature journal. Very excited for the new start! A great thanks to Shenhao, Yunhan, Taka, Esteban, and Sandy. The great team, Cheers.

title: January, 2024
content: Honored to receive the UROP Materials Grant funding.

title: December, 2023
content: One paper on Offline Reinforcement Learning is accepted by AAAI'24. This is the first work to develop Offline RL for large-scale order dispatching problems.

title: December, 2023
content: One paper on Time-Constrained Actor-Critic Reinforcement Learning is accepted to IEEE TMC.

title: November, 2023
content: Invited to serve on the NSF Panel.

title: November, 2023
content: Glad to hear that my Curricular Request for Data Science for Smart Cities has been approved by UCC and assigned an official course number CAP5795 after about one year with several rounds of revision. This course will be the first Data Science for Smart Cities course offered in Florida. Looking forward to witnessing the impact at the State University System of Florida.

title: October, 2023
content: One paper about UQ is accepted to TGL@NeurIPS as one of the four long Spotlight Papers (Best Paper Candidate) for a 20-minute presentation.

title: October, 2023
content: One paper is accepted to IEEE TMC.

title: October, 2023
content: My undergraduate student Judah Alter was funded by the FSU UROP (Undergraduate Research Opportunity Program).

title: August, 2023
content: Four papers on Smart Cities are accepted by ACM CIKM.

title: June, 2023
content: Our EV project is funded by the Sustainability & Climate Solutions Grant Program with $150,000. Thank Florida State University Office of the President and our Great team.

title: May, 2023
content: One paper about fairness-aware concurrent dispatch is accepted to ACM KDD.

title: April, 2023
content: Honored to receive the FSU Collaborative Collision Runner-up Award 2023. See our video description at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f2dD7-p2ML4

title: March, 2023
content: Honored to receive the FSU FYAP Award with $20,000.

title: March, 2023
content: My undergraduate student Ian Bridges was awarded the FSU IDEA Grant.

title: March, 2023
content: One paper is accepted to IEEE TBD.

content: One paper is accepted to IEEE TKDE.

content: PC for KDD 2023 and PC for IJCAI 2023.

content: Our paper about fairness in last-mile delivery has been accepted to ACM CIKM.

content: I present our NSF CDS&E project in Washington DC.

title: June, 2022
content: I will serve as the Publicity Chair of the 20th IEEE SmartCity 2022. Please consider to submit. http://www.ieee-cybermatics.org/2022/smartcity/index.html

title: June, 2022
content: Our paper on Vehicle-Road Scheduling has been accepted to IEEE TMC.

content: Our paper on Named Entity Recognition has been accepted to IEEE TITS.

title: May, 2022
content: Our paper on Traffic Pattern Inference has been accepted to IEEE TVT.

title: April, 2022
content: I am selected as one of the CPS Rising Stars 2022.

title: April, 2022
content: I will be joining the Department of Computer Science at Florida State University as a tenure-track assistant professor in 2022 Fall. I am looking for motivated Ph.D. and M.S. students, and undergraduate researchers. If you are interested, please email me with a copy of your CV to start a conversation.

title: December, 2021
content: Our paper about using Reinforcement Learning for instant delivery received the Outstanding Paper Award from IEEE RTSS 2021.

content: I was invited to serve as the TPC member of the Web Conference (WWW 2022).

content: I was invited to give a talk at AI TIME.

title: September, 2021
content: I join MIT as a Postdoctoral Associate, working with Prof. Alex 'Sandy' Pentland and Prof. Desheng Zhang.

title: September, 2021

content: I have successfully defended my Ph.D. thesis. Cheers！

content: One paper about deep reinforcement learning for instant delivery dispatching is accepted by IEEE RTSS 2021.

content: I participate in the Summer Institutes in Computational Social Science (SICSS-Beijing). Website: https://sicss.io/2021/beijing/ . Wonderful experience.
